TITLE: Initializing and Configuring oidc-provider in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Basic setup of the oidc-provider module showing how to create a provider instance with a configuration that includes a client definition and start the server on port 3000. This example demonstrates the minimal code required to get an OpenID Connect provider running.
SOURCE: https://github.com/panva/node-oidc-provider/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import * as oidc from "oidc-provider";

const provider = new oidc.Provider("http://localhost:3000", {
  // refer to the documentation for other available configuration
  clients: [
    {
      client_id: "foo",
      client_secret: "bar",
      redirect_uris: ["http://lvh.me:8080/cb"],
      // ... other client properties
    },
  ],
});

const server = oidc.listen(3000, () => {
  console.log(
    "oidc-provider listening on port 3000, check http://localhost:3000/.well-known/openid-configuration",
  );
});
```

TITLE: OIDC Provider Event Signatures
DESCRIPTION: Type definitions for various events emitted by the OIDC Provider. These events cover authentication, token management, session handling, and error scenarios across different endpoints.
SOURCE: https://github.com/panva/node-oidc-provider/blob/main/docs/events.md#2025-04-20_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
interface OIDCProviderEvents {
  "introspection.error": (ctx: Context, error: Error) => void;
  "replay_detection.destroyed": (token: Token) => void;
  "replay_detection.saved": (token: Token) => void;
  "pushed_authorization_request.error": (ctx: Context, error: Error) => void;
  "pushed_authorization_request.success": (ctx: Context, client: Client) => void;
  "pushed_authorization_request.destroyed": (token: Token) => void;
  "pushed_authorization_request.saved": (token: Token) => void;
  "refresh_token.consumed": (token: Token) => void;
  "refresh_token.destroyed": (token: Token) => void;
  "refresh_token.saved": (token: Token) => void;
  "registration_access_token.destroyed": (token: Token) => void;
  "registration_access_token.saved": (token: Token) => void;
  "registration_create.error": (ctx: Context, error: Error) => void;
  "registration_create.success": (ctx: Context, client: Client) => void;
  "registration_delete.error": (ctx: Context, error: Error) => void;
  "registration_delete.success": (ctx: Context, client: Client) => void;
  "registration_read.error": (ctx: Context, error: Error) => void;
  "registration_update.error": (ctx: Context, error: Error) => void;
  "registration_update.success": (ctx: Context, client: Client) => void;
  "revocation.error": (ctx: Context, error: Error) => void;
  "server_error": (ctx: Context, error: Error) => void;
  "session.destroyed": (session: Session) => void;
  "session.saved": (session: Session) => void;
  "userinfo.error": (ctx: Context, error: Error) => void;
}
```

```
| `access_token.saved`                     | `(token)`                              | ... whenever an opaque access token is saved                                                                                                                                                                    |
| `access_token.issued`                    | `(token)`                              | ... whenever a structured access token is issued                                                                                                                                                                |
```

TITLE: Markdown Contributing Guidelines
DESCRIPTION: Markdown formatted contributing guidelines document that outlines the process for contributing to node-oidc-provider, including discussion rules and code of conduct reference.
SOURCE: https://github.com/panva/node-oidc-provider/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-20_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# Contributing to oidc-provider

Please note we have a [code of conduct][coc], please follow it in all your interactions with the
project.

When contributing to this project, please first discuss the change you wish to make via a discussion,
email, or any other appropriate method with the owners of this project before proposing a change 
via a Pull Request. The project promotes and follows current best practices in regards to the 
specifications it implements. A contribution that tries to implement something non-standard will most 
likely be dismissed.

## Rules of the discussions

Remember to be very clear and transparent when discussing any issue in the discussions boards. We
ask that you keep the language to English and keep on track with the issue at hand. Lastly, please
be respectful of our fellow contributors and keep an exemplary level of professionalism at all
times.

[coc]: https://github.com/panva/node-oidc-provider/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
```
